meanings.definition: Putzes (verb): to waste time or engage in foolish or aimless activity.
meanings.sent1: She putzes around the house all day instead of doing her homework.
meanings.sent2: He often putzes with his phone, scrolling through social media for hours.
meanings.sent3: While others work hard, he just putzes away his time with no purpose.
meanings.sent4: Her mind putzes like a broken clock, never focusing on one task for long.
meanings.sent5: The cat putzes lazily in the sun, enjoying the warmth without a care.

meanings.definition: Putzes (noun): a foolish or inept person.
meanings.sent1: Don't listen to him; he's a real putzes when it comes to making decisions.
meanings.sent2: She always ends up with putzes as partners in group projects.
meanings.sent3: The putzes at the party kept spilling their drinks everywhere.
meanings.sent4: He felt like a putzes in the meeting, unable to contribute anything meaningful.
meanings.sent5: The movie character was portrayed as a lovable putzes, always getting into silly situations.
